title: How to see page views for my Kindle book on Amazon - Quora

response.answer_text: You used to be able to track visitors on your Amazon Kindle book pages by inserting an image with a tracking link in your book description as explained in my book The Amazon Analytics Bible. However, a few months ago Amazon disabled the use of several kinds of HTML tags in book descriptions including the ability to insert images which means there is no longer a way to track your visitors on Amazon's site. If you would like to see that data, please email KDP support and ask them to offer it. If enough authors ask, they may actually start giving us better Analytics.

Hi Michael. Sign in to your KDP account and click "reports" on your dashboard. The default metrics that show up on that screen include Kindle Edition Normalized Pages (KENP) Read. Just scroll down the screen below the Units Ordered graph and you will se the KENP graph. If you need to segment out the KENP for a certain title, go back up the page and add filters. I hope you find this information helpful.

Hi, Michael. Please Download Kindle previewer on amazon kindle official website and install in your computer. After installation complete please run this software and open your file and see your Kindle book like amazon kindle after publishing.
